personality development skills episode 8
anger management we all get angry it's a
normal emotion however some of us handle
our anger better than others anger
management is not eliminating anger
completely but to control and direct
your anger it is about you controlling
the anger before the anger takes control
of you
the first step to manage anger is to
identify the sources that make you angry
when you are in the middle of a bad
situation it's hard to think logically
and rationally so understanding what
causes you being angry can help you plan
how to deal with it once you know what
makes you angry you can develop
strategies for dealing with it
strategies to deal with anger
communicate
express your needs and talk about issues
that bother you you deal with potential
and proactively listen listen actively
to what other person has to say by not
listening you may lose out on important
information acknowledge their point of
view and think logically understand
analyze the situation objectively and
understand your role in the conflict
except that you may not always know the
best speak be assertive not aggressive
express your opinion honestly when you
know how to ask for what you want you
will generally feel more in control and
less likely to say things that you will
later regret try not to talk when you
are still upset you might end up saying
something that you will regret later
stay calm use relaxation techniques like
counting from 1 to 10 or take 10 deep
breaths to stay calm you can be more
focused and think better when you're in
peaceful uncontrolled mindset change the
environment if your anger is out of
control move away from the situation
spend some more time with yourself till
you feel relaxed enough to confront the
topic again
use an anger lock every time you're
angry make a note of the cause and the
consequences of your anger analyze the
result in work on controlling it
smile nothing can distress like humor
try to see the funny side of the
situation keep a smile it will help you
accept the situation more gracefully
